title: Russian ministry of defense announces cessation of all partial mobilization activities
Anderson Cooper reacts to decades-old CNN clip of his mother discussing loss
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour speaks with CNN anchor Anderson Cooper about why he started his new podcast "All There Is with Anderson Cooper" and shares a moment of his late mother Gloria Vanderbilt speaking about grief and loss on CNN in 1996.

title: Alleged Paul Pelosi attacker charged with assault and attempted kidnapping
description: The man alleged to have attacked Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, was charged on Monday with federal charges of assault and attempted kidnapping.

title: New study shows surprising 'phenomenon' in bumblebees
description: A team of UK researchers have found that bumblebees can interact with inanimate objects as a form of play despite having no apparent incentive to do so.

title: Russia suspends 'partial mobilization' of citizens for Ukraine war
description: Russia has now announced a stop to its "partial mobilization" of citizens to fight in the country's war on Ukraine.

title: NASA captures 'jack-o'-lantern' image of the sun
description: A NASA observatory captured what appeared to be a jack-o'-lantern-esque smile on the sun's surface, showing what are actually splotches on the sun's surface that are cooler than the surrounding areas.

title: Trump asks Supreme Court to stop IRS from turning over his tax returns to the House
description: Former President Donald Trump has asked the Supreme Court to put on hold the release of his tax returns by the Internal Revenue Service to a Democratic-led House committee.

title: We consume a credit card's worth of plastic *every* week
description: Here's something that will haunt you: You likely consume the rough equivalent of a credit card's worth of plastic every single week.

title: 'Planet killer' near-Earth asteroid spotted, the largest in 8 years
description: Astronomers have spotted three near-Earth asteroids that were lurking undetected within the glare of the sun. One of the asteroids is the largest potentially hazardous object to Earth to be discovered in the last eight years.

title: Instagram goes down for some users
description: Thousands of Instagram users reported issues with accessing the platform on Monday morning.

title: Four people fall ill at LAX airport from 'apparent fume exposure'
description: Four people suddenly fell ill at Los Angeles International Airport on Monday from "apparent fume exposure," according to an incident report from the Los Angeles Fire Department.

title: Tom Brady's rollercoaster 2022: Unretiring, outbursts, losing streaks and divorce
description: Being the NFL's biggest star puts you under the microscope. Every turn, every move, every utterance --  be it on or off the field -- is scrutinized.

title: Why horror films kill at the box office all year round
description: One of Paramount's biggest blockbusters this year is a surprise hit that hasn't slowed down at the box office since opening at No. 1 a few weeks ago. No, I'm not talking about "Top Gun: Maverick." I'm talking about "Smile," the studio's creepy horror hit.

title: As antisemitism grows, so does its dangers to everyone. Here's how you can fight against it
description: Vlad Khaykin directs the Anti-Defamation League's programs on antisemitism.

title: Diddy is unrecognizable dressed as The Joker for Halloween
description: Diddy brought his A-game for Halloween 2022.

title: Khloé Kardashian shares first photos of her baby boy
description: Khloé Kardashian is finally giving fans a glimpse at her baby boy.

title: Want a blue check mark on Twitter? It may soon cost you $19.99 a month
description: Twitter is considering offering verified accounts to users who are willing to pay $19.99 a month for a subscription service, and it may take away the coveted blue check marks of existing users if they don't start paying for the product within 90 days, according to internal Twitter documents viewed by CNN.

title: Elon Musk disbands Twitter's board, cementing control over company
description: Twitter's board of directors was dissolved on Thursday following Elon Musk's takeover of the company, according to a securities filing on Monday.

title: Bono reflects on his 40-year marriage to Ali Hewson
description: Bono's new memoir, "Surrender: 40 Songs, One Story," isn't just about his time and travels with U2. It's about love.

title: Is the threat of 'rainbow fentanyl' candy just another scary Halloween rumor?
description: Every year around the middle of October, reporters start contacting me wanting to talk about rumors of contaminated Halloween treats.

title: Dustin Johnson seals $35m year with LIV Golf team event victory at Trump course
description: Dustin Johnson took his LIV Golf earnings for the season past the $35 million mark with victory in the series' final event of the year in Miami on Sunday.

title: Gulf states use new oil riches to gain regional influence
description: Big Gulf Arab oil states are using the newfound riches they've reaped as a result of the Ukraine war to build economic bridges with their poorer neighbors, some of whom they once considered adversaries.

title: Analysis: A Russian naval base was targeted by drones. Now Ukrainian grain exports are at risk
description: Russia has moved rapidly to cripple the United Nations-brokered Black Sea grain corridor in the wake of the drone attack early Saturday on the Crimean port of Sevastopol.

title: Halloween brings more tricks than treats for investors
description: It's fitting that on Halloween, candy maker Hershey is trading at an all-time high bringing shares nearly 25% this year. But overall, there haven't been too many sweet Kisses for investors this year: Despite a ferocious rally so far in October, there are a lot more losers than winners on Wall Street in 2022.

title: What we know about the attack on Paul Pelosi
description: The man who is alleged to have attacked Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, is expected to be charged with multiple felonies Monday as the shock and horror over the attack continues to cast a pall over Washington.

title: Julia Roberts reveals Martin Luther King Jr. and Coretta Scott King paid the hospital bill for her birth
description: A previously little known fact about Julia Roberts is now more widely known, thanks to social media.

title: Jennifer Coolidge's first day back on 'White Lotus' got sexy
description: Sounds like Jennifer Coolidge had an interesting return to work for the second season of "The White Lotus."

title: Astronomers spy the ghost of a star and cosmic cobwebs
description: Colorful, ghostly remnants drift in space where a massive star exploded 11,000 years ago.

title: What does Russia's withdrawal from a grain deal with Ukraine mean for global hunger?
What does Russia's withdrawal from a grain deal with Ukraine mean for global hunger?
description: Russia's decision to pull out of an agreement that guaranteed safe passage for ships carrying vital grain exports from Ukraine has sparked "grave concerns" over global food supply at a time when the world is already facing a growing hunger crisis.

title: How two strangers met in Peru on Halloween and fell in love
description: It was Claudia Flores Iriarte's first day working at the Point Hostel in Lima, Peru. Claudia was 22, just graduated from college and this was her first job. It was October 31, 2008.

title: Collapsed India bridge that killed 134 was recently repaired, official says
Villa Carpena: The owners of this Italian mansion say it's haunted by Mussolini family ghosts
description: Showcasing fascist dictator Benito Mussolini's military uniform, his beloved motorbike, an iron cradle and a spooky bedroom mirror, Villa Carpena is clearly a museum unafraid of the dark side of history.

title: Oprah Winfrey wants fans to know that she doesn't endorse weight loss gummies or pills
description: Oprah Winfrey is warning fans against falling victim to companies selling weight loss products using her name and image.

title: Inflation isn't going anywhere. Just look at the latest data from Europe
description: European inflation has accelerated to a new record high as energy and food prices in the region continue to skyrocket.

title: A spooky forecast for the future of interest rates
description: When will central banks stop raising interest rates? That's the multi-trillion dollar question that has Wall Street analysts wearing wrist braces from shaking their Magic 8 Balls so hard.

title: Hundreds of Iranian journalists call for the release of two colleagues jailed in Evin prison
description: Hundreds of Iranian journalists are calling for the release of colleagues Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi, who were arrested and sent to Tehran's Evin prison for covering the death of Mahsa Amini, according to independent Iranian newspaper Etemad.

title: Virat Kohli appalled by invasion of privacy after hotel room filmed
description: India's Virat Kohli said he was the victim of an "absolute invasion of privacy" after individuals entered his hotel room in Perth and posted video of his clothes and belongings on social media on Monday.

title: LeBron James stars as the LA Lakers end their miserable start to the new season
description: It's happened, finally.

title: Parts of Kyiv left without electricity and water
description: Russia launched a barrage of missile strikes at Ukrainian cities on Monday as it ramped up its attacks on infrastructure facilities across the country.

title: The school library used to be a sanctuary. Now it's a battleground
description: In September 2021, protesters ambushed the board meeting of the New Jersey school district where I have worked as a high school librarian since 2005. The protesters railed against "Gender Queer," a memoir in graphic novel form by Maia Kobabe, and "Lawn Boy," a coming-of-age novel by Jonathan Evison. They spewed selected sentences from the Evison book, while brandishing isolated images from Kobabe's.

title: Wheat and corn prices jump after Russia quits Black Sea grain deal
description: Prices of wheat and corn on global commodities markets rose on Monday after Russia pulled out of a deal that had allowed some vital grain exports from Ukraine to pass through the Black Sea despite the war.

title: Aaron Rodgers and Green Bay Packers struggles continue as team loses fourth straight against Buffalo Bills
description: On the eve of Halloween, Aaron Rodgers and his Green Bay Packers' nightmare season went to a new level of scary as they lost 27-17 on Sunday night against the Buffalo Bills.

title: Shanghai's Disney Resort closes abruptly over Covid with visitors stuck inside
description: Shanghai's Disney Resort abruptly suspended operations on Monday to comply with Covid-19 prevention measures, with all visitors at the time of the announcement directed to stay in the park until they return a negative test for the virus.

title: US curbs on microchips could throttle China's ambitions and escalate the tech war
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping's push to "win the battle" in core technologies and bolster China's position as a tech superpower could be severely undermined by Washington's unprecedented steps to limit the sale of advanced chips and chip-making equipment to the country, analysts say.

title: Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving defends his tweet about a documentary deemed antisemitic and stands by sharing a video by Alex Jones
description: Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving said that he is "not going to stand down on anything I believe in" after he was condemned by the owner of his NBA team for tweeting a link to a documentary deemed to be antisemitic.

title: Keys to averting disaster in a big crowd
Republicans ride optimistic wave into closing week of campaign, with all eyes on fight for Senate control
description: Republicans are riding a wave of optimism into the closing week of the fall campaign, eyeing seats far deeper into Democratic terrain than party leaders imagined only weeks ago, with rising GOP confidence of winning a strong House majority amid signs that critical Senate seats are also increasingly within their grasp.

title: US convenes over 30 countries to address ransomware as hacks of hospitals, critical infrastructure continue
description: The Biden administration will convene three-dozen allied governments on Monday and Tuesday for a fresh round of talks on how to stem the tide of ransomware attacks that have disrupted critical infrastructure firms around the world and cost businesses many millions of dollars.

title: South Korean authorities say they had no guidelines for Halloween crowds, as families grieve 154 victims
description:
• What we know about the deadly disaster
• CNN reporter returns to the scene

title: Explosions heard in Kyiv Monday morning
description: • Putin is using "food as a weapon of war," says USAID head

title: Explosions heard in Kyiv Monday morning
Costumes sitting in trash bags: CNN reporter returns to area of deadly Halloween incident
description: CNN's Will Ripley reports from an alley next to the spot where a deadly Halloween crowd surge killed more than 150 people in Seoul, South Korea.

title: Video shows scene after deadly bridge collapse in India
description: At least 132 people have been killed in India after a bridge collapsed in the western state of Gujarat, causing hundreds of people to fall into the water, officials said. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

title: Man who allegedly attacked Paul Pelosi had bag with zip ties, source says
Philippine death toll from storm Nalgae rises to 98, disaster agency says
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is set on Monday to fly over flood-submerged districts to inspect the damage after Tropical Storm Nalgae barreled across the Southeast Asian country over the weekend, killing at least 98 people.

title: The Maldives chefs taking a stand on sustainability in the kitchen
description: With the threat of rising sea levels hanging over the resort islands of the Maldives, the country's hospitality industry is continually seeking out new ways to operate as sustainably as possible.

title: A visit to Fari Campus, a Maldives first
description: This entire island houses staff from the nearby luxury resort, Patina Maldives. It was designed to encourage a sense of community and time away from work.

title: Buttigieg says Dems shouldn't be blamed for inflation
description: CNN's Chris Wallace asks Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg why Democrats shouldn't be blamed for the country's high rate of inflation.

title: Keys to averting disaster in a big crowd
Lula da Silva will return to Brazil's presidency in stunning comeback
In pictures: Seoul Halloween crowd surge
description: At least 154 people were killed and over 100 injured in a crowd surge at packed Halloween festivities in the South Korean capital of Seoul on Saturday.

title: Seoul crowd disaster leaves South Korea reeling, as death toll rises to 154
